summary: The Justice for ALS Veterans Act of 2025 aims to extend increased dependency and indemnity compensation to surviving spouses of veterans who die from amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), regardless of how long the veteran had the disease before death. The bill amends Title 38 of the United States Code to ensure that veterans who die from ALS are treated the same, irrespective of their duration with the condition prior to death. The bill's applicability is retroactive to October 1, 2022.
